title: Big Thicket National Preserve: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations        Big Thicket National Preserve issues free camping permits for visitors to backpack into certain areas of the preserve or camp on sandbars along the Neches River and Village Creek. Camping permits are available free of charge at the Big Thicket National Preserve Visitor Center.  Hunters may obtain permits to hunt in any one of six hunting areas in the preserve. Permits must be obtained in person at the visitor center, and hunters must have their current hunting license in order to get a hunting permit. In 2016, staff will begin issuing hunting permits on September 1. Please contact the preserve visitor center at (409) 951-6700 for more information on camping or hunting permits.
